spellcasting.name: Conjuração Inata
headerEntries: A habilidade inata de conjurar magias do Kolyarut é baseada em Sabedoria (CD15). O Kolyarut pode conjurar naturalmente as seguintes magias, sem a necessidade de componentes materiais.

trait.name: Forma Imutável
entries: O Kolyarut é imune a qualquer magia ou efeito que altere sua forma.

trait.name: Resistência Mágica
entries: O Kolyarut tem vantagem em testes de resistência contra magias e outros efeitos mágicos.

trait.name: Regeneração
entries: O Kolyarut recupera 2 pontos de vida no início do seu turno, se tiver pelo menos 1 ponto de vida.

action.name: Ataque Múltiplo
entries: O Inevitável faz 2 ataques com a espada longa, ou 1 ataque de espada longa e um toque vampírico

action.name: Espada Longa
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} para acertar, alcance 1,5m/5ft., um alvo. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) dano cortante.

action.name: Toque Vampírico
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} para acertar, alcance 1,5m/5ft., um alvo. Dano: 12 ({@dice 3d6}) dano necrótico, e o inevitável recupera metade do valor em pontos de vida.

entries.name: Kolyaruts
entries: Before beginning a mission against a deal-breaker, a kolyarut learns as much about the contract or oath as possible. It’s not interested in those who break deals accidentally or against their will— only those who willingly break contracts violate the principle that kolyaruts are created to uphold. If a written contract was broken, the kolyarut typically carries a copy of the contract with it.

entries.name: Talkatives
entries: Kolyaruts are the most talkative of the inevitables, making credible attempts at social niceties such as proper greetings before getting down to the matter at hand. They can use disguise self to appear as almost any kind of humanoid—useful if they need to go undercover to catch their quarry

entries.name: Constructed Nature
entries: A Kolyarut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the bugbear has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn. Any hit the bugbear scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit

trait.name: Grankhul’s Luck (1/day)
entries: If the bugbear must make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and has disadvantage on the roll, it may choose to cancel the disadvantage for that roll instead

trait.name: Leap to Feet
entries: Whenever the bugbear is {@condition prone} it can stand up by spending 5 feet of movement instead of half its speed.

trait.name: Lethargic
entries: The bugbear can not use reactions. In addition, the bugbear can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the bugbear deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the bugbear that isn’t {@condition incapacitated} and the bugbear doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes three scimitar attacks. Immediately after the attacks, the bugbear falls {@condition unconscious} as if under the effect of the sleep spell. The bugbear remains {@condition unconscious} until the end of its next turn, it takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Faux Fumble {@recharge 4}
entries: The bugbear makes a scimitar attack. Immediately after the attack, the bugbear gains the benefit of the Disengage action and its walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end its current turn

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dead tree.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: A Ironthorn pode fazer dois ataque: dois ataques com vine rack ou um ataque com vine rack e um impale. Se uma criatura já estiver agarrada, ela pode usar impale usando uma ação bonus.

action.name: Vine Rake
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. Se o alvo estiver for uma criatura média ou menor, faz um teste de resistência DC13 de Força ou Destreza com desvantagem ou é agarrado e impedido.

action.name: Impale
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. O alvo tem que realizar um teste de Constituição {@dc 15} ou recebe um veneno que lhe causa {@dice 1d4} de dano de Constituição a cada minuto.

monster.name: Forlorn Husk
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The forlorn husk regains 2 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The forlorn husk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Drawn to Water
entries: If presented with a source of visible water, a forlorn husk must attempt a {@dc 15} Wisdom save; if it fails, it relinquishes its grip on any victim it might have and goes after the water instead (possibly attempting to disarm the creature holding it). The forlorn husk then spends its next turn drinking the water as a full-round action. A forlorn husk can even be tricked into drinking holy water in this fashion, though it is allowed a {@dc 15} Wisdom check to see if it notices that it is about to drink something that can harm it. A forlorn husk that is attacked before it can drink the water immediately turns to that foe and resumes its attacks. Only if left unassaulted during this turn does it consume the water it seizes.

trait.name: Water Drain
entries: If a living target has an open wound, a forlorn husk can drain moisture from the victim by making a successful grapple check. Each such attack deals {@dice 2d6} points of dessication damage to the victim. On each such successful attack, the forlorn husk gains 5 temporary hit points that last for up to 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The forlorn husk can use its claws and makes two attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Distraction
entries: Any living creature that begins its turn with a swarm in its space must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution save or bocomes nauseated ({@condition incapacitated}) for 1 round.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: Any death scarab swarm with at least 1 hit point per Hit Die (or 8 hit points, for a standard death scarab swarm) forms a hive mind, giving it an Intelligence of 6. When a death scarab swarm is reduced below this hit point threshold, it becomes mindless.

trait.name: Natural Climber
entries: A death scarab swarm can always take 10 on a Athletics check, even if rushed or threatened.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}8 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 4 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Consume
entries: A death scarab swarm can attempt to instantly consume prey by entering a creature directly through the skin or by crawling into its mouth and other orifices to eat the target both inside and out. If a scarab swarm successfully distracts a foe it surrounds, it takes advantage of the distraction, and the swarm enters the distracted prey’s body. Once scarabs have entered a creature, the victim automatically takes {@dice 2d6} points of damage in each subsequent round. If the swarm slays the prey, it is considered completely consumed, leaving nothing behind but equipment.

Any magic cure, remove disease or heal spell cast on a victim being consumed expels the invading scarabs (in that round, anyway; the swarm can attempt to consume again on the following round if all other conditions are met).

Death scarabs are vicious, undead beetles that reside in some desert tombs. A single death scarab resembles a round, night-black beetle 1-1/2 inches long. Death scarabs exhibit no fear, and when swarming, these creatures seem unstoppable.
While living scarab beetle swarms are terrible to contend with, the tenacity of death scarab swarms is something living swarms cannot duplicate.
Death scarab swarms are visually distinct from living beetles in that they are black all over, and an individual is slightly larger than its living counterpart.
